text: Finally switched over from GDAL 3.0 directly to 3.2, so new formats (COG, FlatGeobuf), and many other improvements: <https://github.com/JuliaGeo/GDAL.jl/pull/108|https://github.com/JuliaGeo/GDAL.jl/pull/108>

elements.text: Finally switched over from GDAL 3.0 directly to 3.2, so new formats (COG, FlatGeobuf), and many other improvements:

text: With the new PROJ etc, is there anything breaking in syntax?

elements.text: With the new PROJ etc, is there anything breaking in syntax?

text: PROJ has been on 7 for a while. 7 still retains the old API, though deprecated. The next release, 8, will drop those. Proj4.jl has the bare bindings of the new API, but for the high level API still relies on the old API. So it would be good to move Proj4.jl away from that soon, such that we are ready for PROJ 8.

elements.text: PROJ has been on 7 for a while. 7 still retains the old API, though deprecated. The next release, 8, will drop those. Proj4.jl has the bare bindings of the new API, but for the high level API still relies on the old API. So it would be good to move Proj4.jl away from that soon, such that we are ready for PROJ 8.

text: Is there a trick to getting the Yggdrasil script to run locally? I am trying with `julia --color=yes build_tarballs.jl --verbose --debug` on `Julia 1.7.0-DEV` using `BinaryBuilder#master` and keep running into dependency version issues.
